      Consider contexts longer or equal to these many tokens.

      Use first two letters of the POS tag
      static boolean useContextNERRestriction
      If the NER tag of the context tokens is not the background symbol, generalize the token with the NER tag

      Ignore words like "a", "an", "the" when matching a pattern.

      Consider contexts on the right of a token.

    • Field Detail

      • usePOS4Pattern

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="usePOS4Pattern")
public static boolean usePOS4Pattern
        Use POS tag restriction in the target term: One of this and addPatWithoutPOS has to be true.

      • useCoarsePOS

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="useCoarsePOS")
public static boolean useCoarsePOS
        Use first two letters of the POS tag

      • addPatWithoutPOS

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="addPatWithoutPOS")
public static boolean addPatWithoutPOS
        Add patterns without POS restriction as well: One of this and usePOS4Pattern has to be true.

      • minWindow4Pattern

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="minWindow4Pattern")
public static int minWindow4Pattern
        Consider contexts longer or equal to these many tokens.

      • maxWindow4Pattern

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="maxWindow4Pattern")
public static int maxWindow4Pattern
        Consider contexts less than or equal to these many tokens -- total of left and right contexts be can double of this.

      • usePreviousContext

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="usePreviousContext")
public static boolean usePreviousContext
        Consider contexts on the left of a token.

      • useNextContext

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="useNextContext")
public static boolean useNextContext
        Consider contexts on the right of a token.

      • numMinStopWordsToAdd

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="numMinStopWordsToAdd")
public static int numMinStopWordsToAdd
        If the whole (either left or right) context is just stop words, add the pattern only if number of tokens is equal or more than this. This is get patterns like "I am on X" but ignore "on X".

      • useTargetParserParentRestriction

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="useTargetParserParentRestriction")
public static boolean useTargetParserParentRestriction
        Adds the parent's tag from the parse tree to the target phrase in the patterns

      • useContextNERRestriction

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="useContextNERRestriction")
public static boolean useContextNERRestriction
        If the NER tag of the context tokens is not the background symbol, generalize the token with the NER tag

      • useFillerWordsInPat

        @ArgumentParser.Option(name="useFillerWordsInPat")
public static boolean useFillerWordsInPat
        Ignore words like "a", "an", "the" when matching a pattern.
